message_1: There are 6 people in a group and they need to form a committee of 3 people. In how many ways can this be done?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to form a committee of 3 people from a group of 6 people, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (6 in this case) and k is the number of people in the committee (3 in this case). The exclamation mark denotes the factorial of a number.

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!(6-3)!)

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!3!)

C(6, 3) = (6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(3 × 2 × 1))

C(6, 3) = (720) / (6 × 6)

C(6, 3) = 720 / 36

C(6, 3) = 20

So there are 20 different ways to form a committee of 3 people from a group of 6 people.
